issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: "yarn logs" command fails to get logs for running containers if UI authentication is enabled.

comments.body:
Fixing title.

Debugged this with [~xgong] and [~djp]. "yarn logs" never worked with running containers once it started depending on NM REST APIs.

The underlying issue is that the logs CLI code failed to do SPNEGO auth to pass along the kerberos credentials to the REST API.
Test the patch in secure/un-secure environment, and it fixes the issue

This message was automatically generated.
Thanks [~nmaheshwari] for reporting the issue and [~xgong] for delivering a patch. The patch looks OK to me in general. [~xgong], is it possible to add a UT to cover this case?

Thanks,[~djp] for the review.

bq. is it possible to add a UT to cover this case?

It is very hard to add a UT for this. This is for using CLI to call NW/ATS web-service. Previously, we were using mock function to mimic the Restful calls. By testing this fix, we need to *real* restful calls. Anyway, I have test the fix in both secure/unsecure environment manually to make sure it fixes our problem.
Thanks for reply, Xuan! Agree that this is not easy to add a UT and the fix looks straightforward. +1. Will commit it shortly if no further comments.
I have commit the patch to trunk, branch-3.0 and branch-2. Thanks [~xgong] for the contribution and [~nmaheshwari] for reporting.
